title: Everyday English Course 124
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: It's not as hard as expected.
It's too tough for some students.
It's much more difficult than people think.
instances.correctAnswer: It's much more difficult than people think.

variables.a: What did the man say about the course?

answerOptions: The man likes the classical art in a higher degree.
The man likes the modern art better.
The man likes neither modem nor classical art.
instances.correctAnswer: The man likes the modern art better.

variables.a: What kind of art does the mall prefer?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: You mean Jack has stopped smoking, Frank? That's amazing.
M: Yes, it's really amazing. He used to be a chain smoker, you know.
W: What about you? Have you thought about quitting smoking?
{a}

M: Yes, it's really amazing. He used to be a chain smoker, you know.
W: What about you? Have you thought about quitting smoking?
{a}

{a}

variables.a: Who has given up smoking?

answerOptions: He doesn't know why the coffee tastes bad.
He thinks they ought to go to the coffee shop.
He only wants coffee because he isn't hungry.
instances.correctAnswer: He thinks they ought to go to the coffee shop.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: I didn't think much of that performance.
M: No. It wasn't too hot. What a pity, they're a good group after all.
W: I couldn't hear the lead singer at all.
M: Me neither. The guitars and drums were too bad.
{a}

M: No. It wasn't too hot. What a pity, they're a good group after all.

{a}

What are the two speakers doing?

answerOptions: The man didn't want to buy it.

variables.a: Did they buy the dress?

answerOptions: About buying a new wool sweater.

variables.a: What are they talking about?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Are you feeling better today?
W: Yes, thanks. I think I can go home tomorrow.
M: No, I'm afraid you will stay in hospital for a few more days.
{a}

variables.a: Where is the woman now?

questionTemplates.text_en:
Boy: Mum, have we got any fruit to take on the picnic? I thought there were some oranges and bananas.
Mother: Here are the bananas. Let's take them. Oh the oranges have all gone. What about taking some grapes or apples as well?
Boy: OK, let's take the grapes. That'll be enough.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:

Boy: OK, let's take the grapes. That'll be enough.
{a}

variables.a: What fruit will they take?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Does your mother like travelling?
W: Yes, she does. But she is an armchair traveler. She says that with books, magazines, TV and the Internet, she can go anywhere, and still enjoy the comforts of home!
M: That's interesting. My mother prefes to travel with a tour group while my father enjoys traveling alone.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Does your mother like travelling?
W: Yes, she does. But she is an armchair traveler. She says that with books, magazines, TV and the Internet, she can go anywhere, and still enjoy the comforts of home!
M: That's interesting. My mother prefes to travel with a tour group while my father enjoys traveling alone.
{a}

The woman saw a horror movie.
The man asked the woman to be careful at night.
instances.correctAnswer: The woman saw a horror movie.

answerOptions: Some students at the back cannot hear the professor.
The professor has changed his reading assignment.
Some of the students are not on the professor's list.
instances.correctAnswer: Some of the students are not on the professor's list.

answerOptions: There will be a short delay.
There will be a long delay.
instances.correctAnswer: There will be a short delay.

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: He enjoys finding fault with exams.
He is sure of his success in the exam.
He doesn't know if he can do well in the exam.
instances.correctAnswer: He is sure of his success in the exam.

variables.a: What does the man mean?
Whose book is it?
What is happening outside?

answerOptions: She has almost recovered from her cough.
She saw the doctor four days ago.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: His mother died some time ago.
He hasn't taken good care of his son.
instances.correctAnswer: He hasn't taken good care of his son.

variables.a: Why does the man blame himself?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Have you heard about the new Iphone?
M: Yes, I heard it's supposed to come out in June. Are you thinking about getting one?
W: I'd like to. It's not only a cell phone, but a camera, PDA and MP3 player all in one.
{a}

answerOptions: Suggest him not to reply impolitely to his parents.
